intro: Microcos saccinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined microcos, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate with prominent, parallel veins, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in open woodlands and along stream banks.
